name: 10.11 "I'm OK, You're Defective" Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: What didn't Frasier want to do?
options: Go to lunch with his co-workers
questions.explanation:
Make out a will.

	Lilith said he'd been avoiding it for months. Frasier thought that if he didn't talk about death, it wouldn't happen.

questions.text: Paul asked what it was about him that's a turnoff. What did Carla answer?
questions.explanation:
It's your looks.

	Carla said she could tell Paul was hurting and upset. Therefore she was going easy on him. Paul felt like "everyone's punching bag".

questions.text: How many months had Rebecca and Sam been trying to get pregnant?
questions.explanation:
6.

	Rebecca came into the bar yelling loudly, "we've been going at it for six months like a couple of monkeys and I'm still not pregnant." Sam told her there was an inside voice and an outside voice and that was her outside voice.

questions.text: Sam told Rebecca they weren't conceiving because she's too mean. What did she reply?
questions.correct: No I'm not. I'm perfectly nice. I just think you're shooting blanks pal.
options: Be a man and suck it up.
I know, but it's only because you haven't given me a baby yet.
No I'm not. I just think it's your fault.
questions.explanation:
No I'm not. I'm perfectly nice. I just think you're shooting blanks pal.

	Rebecca wanted same to see a fertility specialist. Sam said he didn't want to go.

questions.text: How did Frasier reply when asked if he wanted to be left on life support if he were in a bad accident?
questions.correct: He told Lilith to smother him tonight with a pillow.
options: He told Lilith to smother him tonight with a pillow.
He started to cry because Lilith wanted to kill him off.
questions.explanation:
He told Lilith to smother him tonight with a pillow.

	Frasier was not handling the will well at all. Lilith was very matter a fact about it and had no trouble with the will.

questions.text: Where did Norm and Cliff go without Paul?
questions.explanation:
McDonald's.

	Paul always felt excluded. Norm made up a story about going hang gliding, dinner with a Miss Massachusetts finalist, and riding around on a fire truck. When Paul said , "You're kidding," Norm told him all they did was go to McDonald's.

questions.text: Was Rebecca the one with the problem regarding getting pregnant?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Her doctor called and gave her the news that it wasn't her. Rebecca told Sam, "It's not me, it must be you."

questions.text: Why weren't the Cranes talking about Lilith's death?
questions.correct: Because she would statistically outlive him
options: They wanted to focus on one death at a time
They made her will out months ago.
questions.explanation:
Because she would statistically outlive him.

	Frasier told her she was probably looking forward to being the widower Crane. Frasier said he's afraid to start his car in the morning. Lilith said she could think of a more subtle way than that to kill him. Then she said, "drink your drink, darling."

questions.text: How did Carla convinced Sam to go to the the fertility doctor?
questions.correct: He's been with thousands of women and has never gotten a Father's Day card.
options: He just needed to man-up and do it.
She said people who have the most sex usually have the least amount of sperm.
It would make Rebecca feel better.
questions.explanation:
He's been with thousands of women and has never gotten a Father's Day card.

	He then got angry with Carla. He agreed to go to prove her wrong.

questions.text: At the end of the episode, it showed Lilith and Frederick at the reading of Frasier's will. What did the contents in the envelope say?
questions.correct: Sam Malone's sperm count is well in normal range.
options: I Frasier, being of sound mind...
Sam Malone's sperm count is well below normal range.
questions.explanation:
Sam Malone's sperm count is well in normal range.

	The will envelope and fertility envelope looked the same.  Apparently, they got mixed up. Lilith ended the episode saying something rude about the bar.
